trans.ptxt: NOTE: Avoid MAG welding for high-strength steel ( MPa) parts.

If a high-strength steel part ( MPa or higher) is MAG welded, the welding wire used must have a tensile strength equal to, or greater than, the lowest tensile strength of the parts being welded. The wire below, or equivalent, may be used for MPa or less (except butt welding for MPa) high-strength steel welding.

trans.title: Welding Specifications for High-Strength Steel (Except MPa)

entry.ptxt: Example: Bosch Automotive Service Solutions solid wire (SSJ-DS980J)

trans.ptxt: NOTE: For details concerning the welding wire, confirm the product specifications issued by the welding wire manufacturer.

trans.title: Sheet thickness vs. plug hole diameter; unit: mm (in)
